Description: Concave offset lip and body fragment (mended from two sherds) of perhaps Attic pottery cup; wholly glazed inside and out; inscription cut on exterior.
Curator's comments: The dull glaze is atypical of Attic, but the sherd seems better placed there. Compare the slightly more fine cup 1900,0214.16.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 88)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 647, no. 50)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2190)
